description: When the user feels sorrow, emotional heaviness, grief, or tearful distress — this content uplifts the soul with reminders of hope, closeness to Allah, and emotional healing.

primary.text_en: He said, 'I only complain of my suffering and my grief to Allah, and I know from Allah that which you do not know.'
primary.text_ar: إِنَّمَآ أَشْكُوا۟ بَثِّى وَحُزْنِىٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ...
primary.explanation: Even Prophet Yaqub cried. Sadness doesn't contradict faith — it’s part of it.

primary.text_en: Do not grieve; indeed, Allah is with us.
primary.explanation: Sadness doesn’t last — but Allah’s companionship does.
Sadness is never permanent — ease is promised twice.

primary.text_en: Are these the ones you swore Allah would never show mercy to? 'Enter Paradise. No fear will there be upon you, nor will you grieve.'
primary.text_ar: ٱدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْجَنَّةَ ۖ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَا أَنتُمْ تَحْزَنُونَ
primary.explanation: There is a place where sadness will never touch you again — hold on till then.

primary.text_en: Allah does not burden a soul beyond what it can bear...
primary.text_ar: لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَا...
primary.explanation: If you're facing it — you're stronger than you feel right now.

extra.text_en: So do not weaken and do not grieve, and you will be superior if you are [true] believers.
extra.text_ar: فَلَا تَهِنُوا۟ وَلَا تَحْزَنُوا۟ وَأَنتُمُ ٱلْأَعْلَوْنَ...
extra.explanation: Sadness doesn’t define your worth. Faith lifts you again.

extra.text_en: Whoever does righteousness... We will surely grant them a good life...
extra.explanation: A good life includes joy again — your heart will smile soon.

extra.text_en: And We already know that your heart is distressed by what they say.
extra.explanation: Even the Prophet ﷺ was saddened — and Allah acknowledged it.

extra.text_en: Fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice. He will correct your deeds and forgive you...
extra.text_ar: يُصْلِحْ لَكُمْ أَعْمَٰلَكُمْ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ذُنُوبَكُمْ...
extra.explanation: Your sadness is not punishment — sometimes it’s purification.

extra.text_en: Do not grieve. Your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.
extra.explanation: In her moment of deepest sorrow, Maryam (AS) was comforted — so will you.

primary.text_en: Verily, Allah does not wrong the believer — He compensates him for every sorrow, even the prick of a thorn.
primary.explanation: Not a tear is wasted — every sadness earns reward.

primary.text_en: No fatigue, illness, sorrow, sadness, hurt, or distress befalls a Muslim... except that Allah expiates his sins by it.
primary.explanation: Your sadness is wiping away sins — silently healing you.

primary.text_en: The most severely tested people are the Prophets, then those nearest to them in righteousness...
primary.explanation: If you're tested deeply, you're walking the path of the beloveds.

primary.text_en: The heart grieves and the eyes shed tears, but we do not say except what pleases our Lord...
primary.explanation: Sadness is not disbelief — it's human, even for Prophets.

primary.text_en: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from sadness and grief...
primary.explanation: Even the Prophet ﷺ taught us to *name* our sadness and pray through it.

extra.text_en: There is no Muslim who is afflicted with a calamity but says what Allah has commanded... except that Allah will compensate him with something better.
extra.explanation: Pain has replacement — better than what you lost is coming.

extra.text_en: If Allah loves a people, He tests them...
extra.explanation: Sometimes sadness is love in disguise — purification of the soul.

extra.text_en: Be in this world as if you were a stranger or a traveler.
extra.explanation: Your sadness isn’t final — this isn’t the destination.

extra.text_en: The Prophet ﷺ used to say: 'O Turner of the hearts, keep my heart firm upon Your religion.'
extra.explanation: Emotional swings are part of the journey — keep asking for stability.

extra.text_en: Indeed, help comes with patience, and relief comes with hardship.

duas.text_en: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from anxiety and grief, weakness and laziness, cowardice and miserliness, the burden of debts and from being overpowered by men.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْهَمِّ وَالْحَزَنِ...
duas.explanation: A holistic dua — mentioned by the Prophet ﷺ for emotional and worldly pressures.

duas.text_en: O Turner of the hearts, make my heart firm upon Your religion.
duas.text_ar: يَا مُقَلِّبَ الْقُلُوبِ ثَبِّتْ قَلْبِي عَلَىٰ دِينِكَ
duas.explanation: Stability in deen often brings peace in emotions too.

reflection: Sadness is a bridge — not a wall. It connects your heart back to its Source. Cry, complain, and release — but to the One who listens best. Don’t bottle your pain; bow with it. The night might be heavy, but every sunrise carries a verse of hope. You’re not abandoned — you’re being carried.
